info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:31PM EDT until August 29 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN INGHAM...GRATIOT...CLINTON AND NORTHERN EATON COUNTIES... At 430 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ithaca to near St. Johns to 6 miles northwest of Charlotte, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lansing... Alma... Charlotte... Mason... St. Johns... Ithaca... East Lansing... Grand Ledge... St. Louis... Williamston... Potterville... Breckenridge... Elsie... Edgemont Park... DeWitt... Capital Region Inter... Eureka... Wheeler... Sumner... Ovid... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
